alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:43PM MDT until August 16 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen, particularly near and west of Gallup. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gallup, Rock Springs, Yah-Ta-Hey, Manuelito, Tse Bonito, Church Rock, Mentmore, Allison, Gamerco, Red Rock State Park and Twin Lakes. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 from the Arizona border to Mile Marker 28. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
